title: The Intelligence - “The red lines that Beijing intended with this law are becoming clearer”—arrests in Hong Kong
summary:
“The red lines that Beijing intended with this law are becoming clearer”—arrests in Hong KongA NATIONAL-SECURITY LAW by Beijing had not, until this week, bared its teeth; the arrests of dozens of pro-democracy figures reveals how much it can crimp opposition.
At the American Economics Association’s annual shindig, a scholar implores economists to recalibrate just how self-interested they take people to be.
And the inspiring life and untimely death of a beloved, goat-herding refugee.
